title: "./go-ethereum/consensus/ethash"mining issue with private ethereum network
body:
Hi there,

please note that this is an issue tracker reserved for bug reports and feature requests.

For general questions please use the gitter channel or the Ethereum stack exchange at https://ethereum.stackexchange.com.

#### System information

Geth version: `geth version` 1.8.10-stable-eae63c51
OS & Version: Windows 32-bit ,2Duo core CPU P8400 @2.26Ghz 
#### Expected behaviour
to start mining

#### Actual behaviour


C:\Users\pcadmin>

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
miner.start() command is giving this error log after displaying
INFO [07-06|17:26:09] Starting P2P networking
INFO [07-06|17:26:10] RLPx listener up                         self="enode://818
42eaec4bda0ea6b3f3a83b71b325ef82d4811bbd9b6eaa8000dd862c82a7952a3e022f23b59ed43c
be0c91b45ef3dd0b9f91ace675ea6eb5b05685b553b31@[::]:3000?discport=0"
INFO [07-06|17:26:10] IPC endpoint opened                      url=\\\\.\\pipe\\
geth.ipc
INFO [07-06|17:26:10] HTTP endpoint opened                     url=http://127.0.
0.1:8545 cors=* vhosts=localhost
INFO [07-06|17:26:24] Etherbase automatically configured       address=0x947C260
42FbC32CcE5376e4Bb53C15FFB2fe2DBB
INFO [07-06|17:27:55] Updated mining threads                   threads=0
INFO [07-06|17:27:55] Transaction pool price threshold updated price=18000000000

INFO [07-06|17:27:55] Starting mining operation
INFO [07-06|17:27:55] Commit new mining work                   number=1 txs=0 un
cles=0 elapsed=0s
INFO [07-06|17:27:58] Generating ethash verification cache     epoch=0 percentag
e=57 elapsed=3.000s

#### Backtrace
unable to backtrace.
````
[backtrace]
````

>
Did it crash? Where did you get the goroutine dump from?

i got this dump from the console after 
INFO [07-06|17:27:55] Commit new mining work number=1 txs=0 un
cles=0 elapsed=0s
INFO [07-06|17:27:58] Generating ethash verification cache epoch=0 percentag
e=57 elapsed=3.000s
and later connection got crashed.
Whoops, this is a new issue, sorry.

Hello,

I am getting the same problem in geth while trying to start mining in a private network. The network crashes suddenly and there is no fault description at the console except a long list of goroutines.

I have tried rebooting the system and reinstalling the geth client but the result is same.

Is that a bug or do I need to recheck the system specifications?

Hey!
Are you trying in 64bit, i5 processor??
My problem got resolved with that above configuration
